abstract: BlackRock, the giant money manager, said it would have no choice but to move some of its business away from certain Wall Street firms if Moody’s Investors Service went ahead with its threat to downgrade some of the country’s biggest banks.
snippet: BlackRock, the giant money manager, said it would have no choice but to move some of its business away from certain Wall Street firms if Moody’s Investors Service went ahead with its threat to downgrade some of the country’s biggest banks.
lead_paragraph: BlackRock, the giant money manager, said it would have no choice but to shift some of its business away from certain Wall Street firms if Moody’s Investors Service went ahead with its threat to downgrade some of the country’s biggest banks.

headline.main: BlackRock to Shift Business if Moody’s Downgrades Banks

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Credit Ratings and Credit Rating Agencies

byline.original: By Susanne Craig and Ben Protess
